chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Marie-Ann Linhart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kayla Marie-Ann Linhart in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM88 and 15CT101 heard at this time. Bub states 15CT101 will be set for a plea at another time. OSullivan files an amended information on 15CF118. Moves to dismiss 15CM88. Guilty to both counts contained in the amended information. 1 year probation: AODA, apologize to victim's aunt. Bub and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in the amended information; Bub stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 and Ct#2 contained in the amended information. Court dismisses 15CM88. Before leaving today, set 15CT101 for next hearing. OSullivan and Bub give sentencing arguments. Court: S/W 1 year; each concurrent. conditions: court costs, AODA and F/T, apology letter to Lisa Linhart that satisifies the Agent, and DNA surcharge.

2:06 p.m.  15CM88 to follow.  Defendant Kayla Marie-Ann Linhart in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information Filed with the Court on June 6, 2015 and a copy was given to the defendant.     Defendant enters not guilty plea to count 1, count 2 and count 3 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.  Reminds defendant of absolute sobriety condition.  Pretrial Conference to be set.

9:42 a.m.  Includes 15CM88.  Defendant Kayla Marie-Ann Linhart in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie calls Officer Chase McKahan.  Thorie examines McKahan.  McKahan identifies defendant.  Attorney Bub cross-examines Officer McKahan.  Bub gives argument.  Thorie gives argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Thorie to file information.  Arraignment to be scheduled at a later date.  Bond to continue.  Court reviews bond conditions.
